question: Does it comes under sunnah to perform collective prayer (da'wah) for the dead every year?? Also is it right to give treat on that day every year?
answer:
QUESTION

Does it comes under sunnah to perform collective prayer (da'wah) for the dead every year?? Also is it right to give treat on that day every year?

ANSWER


Share:

 

In the name of Allāh, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalāmu ῾alaykum wa Rahmatullāhi Wabarakātuh

 

Our Illustrious Fuqahā have regarded it to be Makrūh (undersirable) to call upon gatherings for  the Isāle thawāb (recurring reward) of the Mayyit.

(āp ke masā’il ūr ‘unkā hal, Vol.3, Pg.188)

 However, if the purpose of the gathering is to lighten the grief of the relatives of the deceased, then it will be permissible. Gathering of this nature should be held occasionally not annually.

(āp ke masā’il ūr ‘unkā hal, Vol.3, Pg.192)

As far as feeding is concern, one should remember the deceased will only receive the reward of feeding the poor, as for entertaining the guest or treating relatives,that will be considered as D῾awat.

(āp ke masā’il ūr ‘unkā hal, Vol.3, Pg.188)

 

And Allāh Ta῾āla Knows Best
Wassalāmu ῾alaykum

 

Ml. Abduz Zaman,
Student Dārul Iftā
